alert.note: Alert for Chickasaw; Floyd; Howard; Mitchell (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 3:02AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Mitchell, Howard, Floyd, Chickasaw, southern Olmsted, Mower, southern Dodge and western Fillmore Counties through 400 AM CDT... At 302 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Austin to 8 miles east of Sheffield. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Austin around 305 AM CDT. Rockford and Rose Creek around 310 AM CDT. Brownsdale around 315 AM CDT. Charles City and Grand Meadow around 330 AM CDT. Nashua around 335 AM CDT. Stewartville, Spring Valley and Ionia around 340 AM CDT. New Hampton around 350 AM CDT. Chatfield, Dover, Lawler and Jerico around 400 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Forestville State Park, Toeterville, Vernon Springs, Bradford, Chickasaw, County Roads T 54 And A 31, Fillmore, Mayville, Highway 30 And County 15 and County Roads V 56 And B 33. This includes Interstate 90 in Minnesota between mile markers 175 and 232. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
